message_1: Solve the inequality 2x + 3 > 7, and graph the solution on a number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 2x + 3 > 7, we'll follow these steps:

1. Subtract 3 from both sides of the inequality:
   2x + 3 - 3 > 7 - 3
   2x > 4

2. Divide both sides by 2:
   2x/2 > 4/2
   x > 2

The solution to the inequality is x > 2.

To graph the solution on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with numbers from -2 to 4 (or any range that includes 2).
2. Place an open circle at 2 (since x > 2, not x â‰¥ 2).
3. Shade the region to the right of the open circle, indicating that all values greater than 2 are part of the solution.

The graph will look like this:

----(2)---->
